intro: Haloragis erecta, commonly known as the erect willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial species that typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments. The plant features slender, erect stems with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences and are usually pink or red in color. Haloragis erecta plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic insects.
